results.title: The Driving force
results.creator_credit: Ronald Craigen, James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The story of the transition of steam trains to diesel, diesel electric and electric locomotives, including the building and testing of diesel electric trains.

results.title: The Driver
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Lawrence Gordon, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Ryan O’Neal is the superstar getaway driver and Bruce Dern is the detective obsessed with capturing the speed maniac regardless of the costs. The Driver is well aware of the cop chasing him and leaves a tantalising trail of evidence in a game in which there can only be one victor. This film is notable for its high octane value, rather than a thoughtful character study with lots of dialogue. Cast also includes Isabelle Adjani as a gambler hired as an alibi for the driver.

results.title: The Drive home
results.brief_description: Everyone wants to know how to find their perfect partner. A woman is driving home, listening to her car radio when the DJ announces a new theory on how to find your perfect partner. Only trouble is, the woman’s car is about to enter a tunnel. Will she ever discover the secret?

results.title: The Drive home
results.creator_credit: Annette Trevitt, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: This 2D hand-drawn animation takes us on a journey through city streets during peak-hour. The distraction of talk-back radio frustrates a lone woman driver when bad reception draws her attention to the road again.

results.title: The Drip
results.brief_description: No matter what the doting Helmut does, his wife Gertrude is never satisfied. But things are about to change. When an ever-increasing drip starts falling from the sky onto Gertrude’s head, it’s Helmut to the rescue!

results.brief_description: When I reached fifty I thought I would be all one piece. I am nothing like my mother but like her I tied my star to drinking man.

results.title: The Dressmaker
results.brief_description: In 1950s Australia, beautiful, talented dressmaker Tilly returns to her tiny hometown to right wrongs from her past. As she tries to reconcile with her mother, she starts to fall in love while transforming the fashion of the town.

constellations_other.name: Atari’s Basketball
constellations_other.description: Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, Atari’s Basketball was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. This set the standard for basketball games that followed.

constellations_other.name: Judy and Punch and many more
constellations_other.description: Women have been oppressed by patriarchal conventions and by men under the guise of the supernatural throughout history, but recent moving-image works are reframing these historical persecutions.

results.description: In 1950s Australia, beautiful, talented dressmaker Tilly returns to her tiny hometown to right wrongs from her past. As she tries to reconcile with her mother, she starts to fall in love while transforming the fashion of the town.

results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: The Dresden Cross Choir in its hometown = Der Dresdener Kreushor in seiner heimatstadt
results.brief_description: The Dresden Choir consists of 80 young men and boys ranging from10-20 years old and has been in existence from 156 years. Shots of the city of Dresden are interspersed with those of the Choir singing in concerts, practising and relaxing.

results.title: The Dreamlife of angels = La Vie revee des anges
results.creator_credit: Erick Zonca, Francois Marquis, Diaphana Films, France 3 Cinema and Les Productions Bagheera
results.brief_description: Erick Zonca’s feature film debut is a subtle, unflinching, yet compassionate look at the relationship between two young women - Isa (Elodie Bouchez) and Marie (Natacha Regnier), who meet while working as machinists in Lille. The two are diametrically different in appearance, attitude towards life, family and friends, and most significantly in relation towards men and Sandrine; a comatose young girl (Sandrine’s mother owns the flat that Isa and Marie are minding). There are moments of real happiness between the two, and the initial stages of their friendship as it develops is captured beautifully, allowing the viewer to absorb the expressions of each girl and speculate about character development. Their paths soon begin to diverge however - unbalancing their friendship, when Marie becomes involved in a self destructive relationship with night club owner Chris (Gregoire Colin), and Isa starts to visit Sandrine after finding the girl’s diary and becoming privy to her innermost thoughts. As the friends drift further away from one another, they are both faced with situations that challenge them and influence their future both as individuals, and as friends. In French with English subtitles.
